name: Easy Dill Hollandaise Sauce
author: Jacob Larson
summary: This hollandaise uses a microwave instead of a double boiler, cutting back tremendously on prep time and mess. The melted butter provides enough heat to cook the sauce. This recipe makes enough sauce to cover 2 servings of eggs Benedict.
directions: Melt butter in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in microwave at 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval to prevent popping, 1 to 2 minutes
Whisk lemon juice, salt, and dill into melted butter; cook in microwave an additional 10 seconds
Whisk egg yolks into butter mixture vigorously until smooth, about 30 seconds
Whisk boiling water in gradually until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute more
